ui.bodyBullet: Now that you have the skills and knowledge to deliver exceptional customer service, it’s time to put into practice what you’ve learned. This module presents four scenarios you might experience on the job.

actui.item: Case Study 1
A customer arrives in his vehicle for his 13,000 kilometer maintenance appointment. He pulls into the service drive and you, as the Service Advisor …
Directions: Select all that apply. Then click “Check Answer.”
Wave the customer over to the first available shop stall so the Technician can begin work immediately
During the interview review with the customer any open recalls or Rapid Response Transmittals that apply to their vehicle
Have the customer immediately sign a pre-written Repair Order that lists every service menu option available
Greet the customer warmly, reconfirm the reason for their visit, ask if there are any additional service needs they want checked
CHECK ANSWER
Correct! Offer a warm greeting and confirm the reason for his visit. Also review any open recalls or Rapid Response Transmittals then identify opportunities for additional sales.

Incorrect. The second and fourth answers are correct. Offer a warm greeting and confirm the reason for his visit. Also review any open recalls or Rapid Response Transmittals then identify opportunities for additional sales.
Case Study 2

A customer returns to your dealership and is dissatisfied because she was forced to come back about the same issue on the same day. When working with this customer, what is the most important thing you have to turn a negative into a positive experience?
Directions: Select the correct answer. Then click “Check Answer.”
Ability to schedule another appointment and the customer to return at the designated time
Knowledge of your dealership’s return policy
A copy of the Repair Order which shows the customer’s written approval
Willingness to listen to the customer and immediately address the problem
CHECK ANSWER
Correct! Go out of your way to turn things around by listening to the customer and addressing the problem immediately.
Incorrect. The fourth answer is correct. Go out of your way to turn things around by listening to the customer and addressing the problem immediately.
Case Study 3

A customer picks up her car after it has been serviced, but comes back to the service area after paying, looking disappointed. When you inquire, she explains that her car has always been washed after being serviced. That didn’t happen this time. How do you respond?
Directions: Select the correct answer. Then click “Check Answer.”
Apologize for the oversight, ensure a quality car wash is completed and notify Service Manager of discrepancy
Apologize but explain to the customer that the car wash is at the dealer’s discretion and needs to be requested at write-up
Immediately contact the Service Manager and move on to other customers
No need to apologize, instruct customer that they’ll get their car washed on their next visit
CHECK ANSWER
Correct! You don’t want the customer to leave unhappy, and you don’t want to brush her off with just an apology or a coupon. Make sure the customer leaves happy and has a reason to come back.

Incorrect. The first answer is correct. You don’t want the customer to leave unhappy, and you don’t want to brush her off with just an apology or a coupon. Make sure the customer leaves happy and has a reason to come back.
Case Study 4

A customer calls in to schedule an appointment to have a Rear Seat DVD Entertainment System installed that had been on back order. After you set the appointment, what should you, as a Service Advisor, do next?
Directions: Select the correct answer. Then click “Check Answer.”
Work with Technician to ensure proper installation procedures have been downloaded from DealerCONNECT
Notify the Parts Department and dispatcher when the customer is coming in and confirm receipt of part and Technician availability
Have Parts Department contact customer again reconfirming that part is now in stock
Contact Chrysler directly via DealerCONNECT Parts tab to confirm receipt of part
CHECK ANSWER
Correct! That’s how a team works together to deliver exceptional customer service!
Incorrect. The second answer is correct. That’s how a team works together to deliver exceptional customer service!
